edu.mines.jtk.util
Class Stopwatch

java.lang.Object
  edu.mines.jtk.util.Stopwatch

public class Stopwatch
extends java.lang.Object

A timer that works like a stopwatch. A stopwatch can be started and stopped. A stopwatch is either running or not running. Stopwatch time can be read in either state, and that time can be reset to zero.

Stopwatch time is elapsed (wall-clock) time, not process or CPU time. Stopwatch time resolution is one nanosecond. In other words, a stopwatch cannot measure a time difference less than one nanosecond. On the other hand, the granularity of the stopwatch depends on the underlying operating system and may be larger.

Version:
2004.11.02
Author:
Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines, Dean Witte, Transform Software
See Also:
System.nanoTime()

Constructor Detail

Stopwatch

public Stopwatch()
Method Detail

start

public void start()
Starts this stopwatch. If the stopwatch is running, does nothing.

stop

public void stop()
Stops this stopwatch. If the stopwatch is not running, does nothing.

reset

public void reset()
Stops this stopwatch and resets the time to zero.

restart

public void restart()
Resets and starts this stopwatch.

time

public double time()
Returns the stopwatch time, in seconds. Does not start or stop.

Returns:
the time, in seconds.
